question: Why do you want to use a fitness app?

options.option: I'm a beginner and one guidance
I am interested in improving my current training routine
I am bored of my workout plan and want more variation
I want an optimal training plan based on my specific needs
I want to know what to do at the gym every time without having to think about it

question: How experienced are you lifting weights?

options.description: new to the gym, not familiar with exercises and equipment. Focus on building training foundation
some gym experience less than one year, familiar with basic exercises but still learning proper form
1 to 2 years of weightlifting experience, good understanding of exercises and form, ready for advanced methods
more than three years of consistent experience, significant strength/muscle development, comfortable with complex exercises

question: Do you know your one rep max?
What are your top fitness goals?

options.description: focus on muscle development and tone your body. Perform pyramid sets to improve your weights in every workout
improve your overall fitness by lifting consistent weights and learning new exercises
focus on higher reps and lower weights through fast-paced supersets to boost overall conditioning
focus on compound exercises, train for muscle per workout and lift heavier weights with lower rep ranges
our AI creates dynamic workouts, prioritizing the muscle groups with the best recovery state
balanced training with double frequency between upper and lower body
blend push, pull, and leg routines with full body sessions to maintain variety and optimize weekly volume
structure allows focus on one movement pattern per day, maximizing stimulus, ideal for hypertrophy
adaptation with additional days split between upper and lower body, increasing frequency and volume
balance training with double frequency for both upper and lower body, rest day between full body sessions
ideal for beginners or limited time, improves strength and endurance without multiple days per week
classic approach, dedicate each session to a single muscle group
focus on legs/glutes twice per week with at least one rest day between sessions
emphasizes upper body development, train push and pull muscles twice per week with rest days

question: How would you like us to select your exercises?

options.description: prioritize a few essential exercises repeated throughout workouts for easier progress tracking
mix of repeated and new exercises for a well-rounded experience with moderate progress tracking
a lot of variety with different exercises in every workout, making progress tracking more challenging
full fitness clubs such as Anytime Fitness, Planet Fitness, etc.
compact gym with limited equipment
barbells, squat rack, dumbbells, and more
